intro: Hieracium dasytrichum var. subpiliferum, commonly known as the woolly hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, featuring a basal rosette of leaves that are hairy and often reddish in color. The plant produces yellow flowers arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a rough texture and are covered in fine, white hairs. This variety is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, where it thrives in full sun to partial shade.
